abstract: Institute of Classical Architecture & Art has restored and put on display dozens of 19th-century plaster casts of Greek and Roman statuary; casts are on loan from Metropolitan Museum of Art, where they were originally exhibited in place of actual ancient marbles and have been kept in storage for decades.

headline.print_headline: Move Over, Marble: Plaster Gets Pride of Place
headline.main: Move Over, Marble: Plaster Gets Pride of Place

keywords.value: General Society of Mechanics and Tradesmen
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: Dozens of plaster casts, many among the finest examples of their kind, have found a home at the Institute of Classical Architecture & Art in Manhattan....
lead_paragraph: Dozens of plaster casts, many among the finest examples of their kind, have found a home at the Institute of Classical Architecture & Art in Manhattan.
